column4: Appearently my integrated VIA sound thingie (dunno what to call it, it isn't a card) can do it.
Well, applications using ALSA are a bit unstable sometimes because ALSA is relatively new.
ALSA from what I know has been around for a while
It's only been in the kernel since 2.6
the kernel yes...but ALSA itself has been around for quite a few years now
Sure, but most apps didn't use it because it wasn't standard.
the thing is that 2.6 is using ALSA as standard...there was support for it before
most applications for example the applications coded against GNOME is using ESD because GNOME is using ESD sound server
and KDE is using another sort of soundserver
ESD supported alsa but the apps themselves didn't have to
The ones that use ALSA now use relatively new code for it so it can be buggy.
ESD and aRtsd aren't even needed anymore and that isn't always true.
hehe....well some of us like the small mini sounds that comes when GAIM or something is sending a msg or something...hehe
